Name: .NET Core 3.1 Desktop Runtime
Notes: Installing dotnetcore-desktopruntime with chocolatey gets latest, currently 3.1, so same as installing 3.1 explicitly via dotnetcore-3.1-desktopruntime, same for dotnet-desktopruntime vs dotnet-9.0-desktopruntime

Name: AI Shell
Notes: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/utility-modules/aishell/get-started/aishell-powershell

Name: AIMP
Notes: As of Aug 2025, AIMP.AIMP Winget package from source winget is way out of date, from source msstore even more so, choco package is current, website is www.aimp.ru

Name: Azure PowerShell
Notes: Installing Azure PowerShell is ~20s faster using chocolatey than using Install-Module, not using this for PC since PC will have them in C:\OD\Modules. As of Jan 2025 still can't find a winget package for Az PowerShell. ('winget search Microsoft.Azure --source winget')

Name: Beyond Compare
Notes: As of Jan 2025, beyondcompare from chocolatey versus winget is the same version 5.0.4.30422, so removing the chocolatey package name ('beyondcompare') so it uses winget

Name: Boom Audio Player
Notes: Simple audio player from maker of foobar2000 https://perkele.cc/software/boom

Name: Cinebench 2024
Notes: Cinebench is a commonly used CPU benchmarking tool. 2024 is newer than R23 but R23 is still used more because people are familiar with the scores and the numbers are higer. Did not find a 2024 winget package as of Feb 2025.

Name: Cinebench R23
Notes: Cinebench is a commonly used CPU benchmarking tool. R23 is older than 2024 but R23 is still used more because people are familiar with the scores and the numbers are higer. Did not find an R23 chocolatey package as of Feb 2025.

Name: CPU-Z
Notes: Winget doesn't have a portable package, only CPUID.CPU-Z. The cpu-z.portable package didn't work for some reason. The non-portable chocolatey CPU-Z package name is cpu-z.install or just cpu-z

Name: CrystalDiskInfo
Notes: As of Jan 2025 there's still no portable version available via winget, only chocolatey has a portable one available

Name: CrystalDiskMark
Notes: As of Jan 2025, winget had the latest version 8.0.6 but the chocolatey package is still 8.0.5, removing the ChocolateyName ('crystaldiskmark') so it will use winget instead

Name: curl
Notes: Win11 22H2 includes curl 8.01 but chocolatey and winget have latest which is 8.2.1 as of 2023-08-27 https://curl.se/download.html, (WS25 RTM has curl.exe 8.8.0)

Name: diskspd
Notes: As of June 2025, the choco package 'diskspd' was still 2.1, but the winget package Microsoft.DiskSpd was 2.2 which is the version used by Crystaldiskmark 9

Name: EA Desktop
Notes: EA Desktop replaces Origin

Name: Everything
Notes: ES.EXE is now in its own choco package named es, not sure if winget has it in a different package or not. Using 'voidtools.Everything.Alpha' until I find a reason not to ('voidtools.Everything' is for the release/non-alpha version)

Name: Everything CLI (ES.EXE)
Notes: Chocolatey package is 'es' but making that null so it use winget instead since I'm trying to use winget as much as possible since its package selection has improved

Name: Greenshot
Notes: Not using choco or winget to install it since neither have the prerelease version

Name: HandBrake
Notes: Handbrake app for playing media files

Name: HandBrake CLI
Notes: HandleBrake command line interface for playing media files

Name: HWInfo
Notes: Can be configured to alert on high temps

Name: JDownloader 2
Notes: GUI download tool https://jdownloader.org/

Name: Lenovo System Update
Notes: System Update is the older Win32 app, Vantage is the newer modern store app https://thinkdeploy.blogspot.com/2018/11/lenovo-vantage-vs-system-update.html

Name: Lenovo Commercial Vantage
Notes: System Update is the older Win32 app, Vantage is the newer modern store app https://thinkdeploy.blogspot.com/2018/11/lenovo-vantage-vs-system-update.html

Name: Lenovo Legion Toolkit
Notes: Community built tool to use to control settings instead of using the first-party Lenovo Vantage app. https://github.com/BartoszCichecki/LenovoLegionToolkit

Name: Lenovo Vantage
Notes: System Update is the older Win32 app, Vantage is the newer modern store app https://thinkdeploy.blogspot.com/2018/11/lenovo-vantage-vs-system-update.html

Name: Libre Hardware Monitor (fork of Open Hardware Monitor)
Notes: https://github.com/LibreHardwareMonitor/LibreHardwareMonitor

Name: LogParser
Notes: As of Jan 2025, Microsoft.LogParser gets you version 2.2.10, which the download site shows as being from 2021, which is probably the latest as I suspect LogParser is very infrequently updated

Name: MediaInfo GUI
Notes: https://mediaarea.net/en/MediaInfo

Name: MediaInfo CLI
Notes: https://mediaarea.net/en/MediaInfo

Name: Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise
Notes: The Winget 'Microsoft.Office' package installs x64 Microsoft 365 Apps for Enterprise, which is what I want, Chocolatey 'microsoft-office-deployment' package installs x86

Name: Microsoft Edge
Notes: Edge is still supported on Win7+ https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-supported-operating-systems

Name: MKVToolNix
Notes: Tools for working with MKV files. Includes MKVExtract for extracting audio from .MKV video file.

Name: Nmap
Notes: Chocolatey nmap package waits for input as it run Npcap installer. Winget package is silent. But both are out of date - https://nmap.org/download.html#windows

Name: Nerd Fonts - CascadiaCode
Notes: Nerd fonts have additional glyphs, icons, and ligatures that regular fonts do not

Name: nodejs
Notes: Winget package appears to be more current, on 2022-05-24, chocolatey (package 'nodejs') had 17.9.0, winget (package 'OpenJS.NodeJS') had 18.2.0, which at that time was the latest on https://github.com/nodejs/node/releases

Name: Nuget CLI
Notes: Chocolatey package had a more current version (6.6.1) than winget (6.5.0), so chocolatey may be the more up-to-date place to get it from

Name: NVEncC
Notes: CLI tool for nvenc encoding https://github.com/rigaya/NVEnc/releases

Name: OneDrive
Notes: As of Jan 2025, the chocolatey package 'onedrive' is stale (24.226.1110.4) compared to Microsoft.OneDrive that is version 24.232.1118.0003.

Name: OneNote for Windows 10
Notes: OneNote for Windows 10 is still installable via winget though doesn't show up when searching for it.

Name: OpenSSH Beta
Notes: https://github.com/PowerShell/Win32-OpenSSH/wiki/Install-Win32-OpenSSH#install-win32-openssh-test-release, Microsoft.OpenSSH.Preview is the bleeding edge, newer than Microsoft.OpenSSH.Beta

Name: ParkControl
Notes: Display and change CPU core parking settings in real-time, as of Jan 2025 could not find an equivalent chocolatey package for it

Name: PC Manager
Notes: https://pcmanager.microsoft.com/ Microsoft.PCManager is the release version, Microsoft.PCManager.Beta the beta

Name: Perfview
Notes: https://github.com/microsoft/perfview, the chocolatey package is 'perfview' but 'Microsoft.PerfView' is the same version as of Jan 2025 so preferring the winget install

Name: PowerShell 7
Notes: Scripting this install instead of using choco/winget since those packages can be stale, but still using chocolatey to install it for QUICKVM

Name: PowerShell 7 Preview
Notes: This package was stale (had 7.2.0-preview.4 when 7.3.0-preview.1 was latest, and since it's easy to get the MSI, just installing it manually instead

Name: PowerToys
Notes: The chocolatey powertoys package waits for input even with --silent, winget package does not wait, though it does launch PowerToys

Name: Promptflow
Notes: https://github.com/microsoft/promptflow and https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/prompt-flow/overview-what-is-prompt-flow

Name: Python
Notes: After Python.PythonInstallManager is installed, run: & 'C:\Program Files\PyManager\py.exe' install 3

Name: Rufus
Notes: Winget doesn't have a portable one, only Rufus.Rufus and 9PC3H3V7Q9CH for msstore

Name: ScreenToGif
Notes: ScreenToGif requires .NET Desktop Runtime 6.0.1+ https://download.visualstudio.microsoft.com/download/pr/bf058765-6f71-4971-aee1-15229d8bfb3e/c3366e6b74bec066487cd643f915274d/windowsdesktop-runtime-6.0.1-win-x64.exe

Name: ShareX
Notes: Greenshot icons still too small on higher resolutions, gave ShareX a shot, kinda meh

Name: Storage Explorer
Notes: The choco package microsoftazurestorageexplorer was two versions behind the winget package Microsoft.AzureStorageExplorer, so installing the winget package

Name: Stremio
Notes: https://www.stremio.com/downloads

Name: Stremio Beta
Notes: https://www.stremio.com/downloads

Name: Sysinternals Suite
Notes: With InstallDir:TOOLSPATH specified the Chocolatey package creates TOOLSPATH (fails if exists), adds TOOLSPATH to PATH, creates HKCU:\SOFTWARE\Sysinternals\<toolname>\EulaAccepted == 1 for all tools, also HKCU:\Software\Sysinternals\SigCheck\VirusTotal\VirusTotalTermsAccepted == 1, 9P7KNL5RWT25 with winget is for the source msstore, Microsoft.Sysinternals for source winget

Name: Terminal-Icons (PowerShell Module)
Notes: By default installs the module in the AllUsers scope for Windows PowerShell (i.e. Desktop Edition). Terminal-Icons is a PowerShell module that adds file and folder icons when displaying items in the terminal. You must be using one of the fonts provided by Nerd Fonts for this module to work as these fonts include tons of custom glyphs/icons that are referenced by their unicode number. Not using this for PC since PC will have them in C:\ODM\Modules

Name: Visual Studio Code
Notes: This defaults to a system install, not user, so it installs to Program Files, not LOCALAPPDATA, not sure how to specify a user install for this package.

Name: WinDbg
Notes: The windbg chocolatey package doesn't work, returns 404, description says This package is likely not broken for licensed users - see https://docs.chocolatey.org/en-us/features/private-cdn

Name: Windows ADK
Notes: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/get-started/adk-install

Name: Windows App
Notes: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-app/overview

Name: Windows Driver Kit 11
Notes: Winget right now only has the Win10 WDK - Microsoft.WindowsWDK - not Win11

Name: Windows Notepad
Notes: Windows Notepad Microsoft Store app supported on Win11 22000+

Name: Windows Terminal
Notes: Note supported on Windows Server SKUs, though may work on WS22 by install the msixbundle. Chocolatey package is microsoft-windows-terminal but leaving it blank so winget installs both terminal and terminal preview. For winget, 9N0DX20HK701 installs from source msstore and Microsoft.WindowsTerminal installs from source winget.

Name: Windows Terminal Preview
Notes: Note supported on Windows Server SKUs, though may work on WS22 by install the msixbundle. Currently no choco package for terminal preview (choco find *windows*terminal* only returns microsoft-windows-terminal). For winget, 9N8G5RFZ9XK3 installs from source msstore and Microsoft.WindowsTerminal.Preview installs from source winget.
